footer.license: Tabbycat is an open-source project developed by volunteers and is free to use.

suggestedDonation.text: For a tournament of this size, we suggest {link}.

donation.link: Donations to Tabbycat from individuals or organisations
donation.text: {link} are much appreciated and help us to continue to develop, support, and maintain Tabbycat.

organisation.title: Our Organisation
organisation.text: Tabbycat is supported by the {association}, a non-profit for advancing open debate technology.

demo.message: {tagline} If you're learning or playing around with Tabbycat, it's easiest to create a demo tournament that is prepopulated with a fake (but typical) set of teams, adjudicators, rooms, and the like. You can then delete this demo tournament later on, or deploy a new instance for your real tournament.

name.title: Name
name.help: O nome completo, por exemplo, "Australasian Intervarsity Debating Championships 2016"

shortName.title: Short name
shortName.help: O nome utilizado no menu, por exemplo, "Australs 2016"

slug.title: Slug
slug.help: O sub-URL do torneio não pode ter espaços, por exemplo, "australs2016"

format.title: Format
format.help: Apply a standard set of settings to match a common debate format. These can be changed afterwards and should be checked for your needs.

elimRoundsTeams.title: Number of teams in the first open elimination round
elimRoundsTeams.help: Leave blank if there are no elimination rounds

publicPages.title: Enable public pages
publicPages.help: Mostrar informações não sensíveis na página pública do site, como posições no debate (uma vez liberadas) e as moções de rodadas anteriores

dataEntry.title: Participant data entry
dataEntry.help: Whether participants can submit ballots and feedback themselves, and how they do so

csv.dragDrop: Drag-and-drop CSV files to quickly import participants
